questions.question_text: The Process Activity View provides a rows-and-columns style view of the events generated in a detection. Why might this be helpful?

choices.D: The Process Activity View creates a count of event types only, which can be useful when scoping the event
choices.B: The Process Activity View will show the Detection time of the earliest recorded activity which might indicate first affected machine
choices.C: The Process Activity View only creates a summary of Dynamic Link Libraries (DLLs) loaded by a process
choices.A: The Process Activity View creates a consolidated view of all detection events for that process that can be exported for further analysis

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A. You can export this list, there is no machine info or links. so A is the only answer

Selected Answer: A
A is the right one

Selected Answer: C
I agree with C.

questions.question_text: Which Executive Summary dashboard item indicates sensors running with unsupported versions?

choices.B: Reduce false positives of behavioral detections from IOA based detections only
choices.C: Reduce false positives of behavioral detections from IOA based detections based on a file hash
choices.A: Reduce false positives based on Next-Gen Antivirus settings in the Prevention Policy
choices.D: Reduce false positives of behavioral detections from Custom IOA and OverWatch detections only

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct Answer is B, B. Reduce false positives of behavioral detections from IOA based detections only 

For the answer A, that is "MACHINE LEARNING EXCLUSIONS", Refer to the "Prevention Policies" setting, the " TYPE : Next-Gen Antivirus", it have one setting call "CATEGORY -- Sensor Machine Learning".

Correct Answer is B, B. Reduce false positives of behavioral detections from IOA based detections only 

For the answer A, that is "MACHINE LEARNING EXCLUSIONS", Refer to the "Prevention Policies" setting, the " TYPE : Next-Gen Antivirus", it have one setting call "CATEGORY
 -- Sensor Machine Learning".

Selected Answer: B
Behavioral-Based Prevention refers to IoA; Next-Gen Antivirus refers to ML.

Selected Answer: B
The answer is B. Reduce false-positive detection alerts from IOAs by creating exclusions that stop behavioral IOA detections and preventions. The only option is going to be since its "IOA detections"
Reduce false-positive detection alerts from IOAs by creating exclusions that stop behavioral IOA detections and preventions.

Selected Answer: A
its written in the docs

questions.question_text: What do IOA exclusions help you achieve?

choices.A: It contains the TargetProcessId_decimal value for other related events
choices.C: It contains the ContextProcessId decimal value for the parent process that made the DNS request
choices.D: It contains the TargetProcessId_decimal value for the process that made the DNS request
choices.B: It contains an internal value not useful for an investigation

questions.question_text: When examining a raw DNS request event, you see a field called ContextProcessId_decimal. What is the purpose of that field?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
agree with D

Selected Answer: D
ContextProcessId of DnsRequest event is equal to the TargetProcessId of the event that spawned the DnsRequest event.

Actually, here I also think it might be D. Look at this reddit post - https://www.reddit.com/r/crowdstrike/comments/hr1kyb/rename_contextprocessid_decimal_as/.
In other words ContextProcessId is generated to enrich the TargetProcessId event and has the same value. The main event won't contain ContextProcessId event, but a TargetProcessId.

comments.content: Not sure about D for this one it says TargetProcessID. NOT TargetProcessId_decimal. Both TargetProcessId and TargetProcessId_decimal are different things. I don't see a correct answer here?

choices.C: stop all Machine Learning Preventions but a detection will still be generated and files will still be uploaded to the CrowdStrike Cloud
choices.D: stop all ML-based detections and preventions for the matching path(s) and/or stop files from being uploaded to the CrowdStrike Cloud
choices.A: stop all detections for a specific pattern ID
choices.B: stop all sensor data collection for the matching path(s)

questions.question_text: The function of Machine Learning Exclusions is to _____________.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer. Found in the "Understand Exclusions" in the docs " Machine Learning (ML) exclusion, Stop all ML-Based Detections and Preventions, or stop files from being uploaded to the Crowdstrike Cloud.

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D, correct.

comments.content: B would be Sensor Visibility Exclusions, not ML
